meanings.definition: Very large or extra large in size
meanings.sent1: The skyscraper was supersized, towering over the city skyline.
meanings.sent2: The supersized pizza was big enough to feed a whole party.
meanings.sent3: The supersized teddy bear looked comically large next to the tiny toy car.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as supersized as the giant sunflower in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The supersized elephant in the zoo was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: To make something larger than usual
meanings.sent1: The chef decided to supersize the fries for the hungry customers.
meanings.sent2: He always liked to supersize his dreams, aiming for the stars.
meanings.sent3: She playfully threatened to supersize his ice cream scoop if he didn't behave.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to supersize the colors on the canvas, making them pop.
meanings.sent5: The magician seemed to supersize the rabbit, pulling it out of the tiny hat.
